channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Redox-Improved Self-Assembled Monolayers for Inverted Perovskite Solar Cells
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 12 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66421-4

Variations in the valence states of nickel oxide hinder the growth of a uniform self-assembled monolayer (SAM). Here, authors develop a SAM with the oxidized product forming S−O−Ni bond at Ni3+-rich regions, achieving maximum device efficiency of 26.5% in operationally stable perovskite solar cells.
item.dc:title: Redox-Improved Self-Assembled Monolayers for Inverted Perovskite Solar Cells
item.dc:creator: Meng Yuan
Yiyang Wang
Zhe Liu
Jinyuan Zhang
Shucheng Qin

item.title: Isofrequency spin-wave imaging using color center magnetometry for magnon spintronics
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 12 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67056-1

Color center magnetometry enables spin-wave imaging in complex magnetic textures. This work overcomes key limitations of current approaches by decoupling sensor spins from control fields and using diamond and hBN color centers for complementary frequency operation, achieving isofrequency imaging of field-controlled spin waves.
item.dc:title: Isofrequency spin-wave imaging using color center magnetometry for magnon spintronics
item.dc:creator: Samuel Mañas-Valero
Yasmin C. Doedes
Artem Bondarenko
Michael Borst
Samer Kurdi
Thomas Poirier
James H. Edgar
Vincent Jacques
Yaroslav M. Blanter
Toeno van der Sar

item.title: Supersolidophobic Pt catalyst for long-term natural seawater electrolysis with hydrogen production and magnesium extraction
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 12 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66473-6

Electrochemical synthesis of solid compounds is an emerging frontier in electrocatalysis. Here, the authors report a Pt catalyst whose surface-coordinated halogens alleviate the scaling effect by regulating the local environment and enable simultaneous Mg(OH)₂ and H₂ production from natural seawater.
item.dc:title: Supersolidophobic Pt catalyst for long-term natural seawater electrolysis with hydrogen production and magnesium extraction
